description: Tooth-coloured full-coverage abutment crown for fixed partial denture.
Tooth-coloured artificial tooth in a fixed bridge to replace a missing tooth.
Full-coverage crown (e.g., lithium disilicate/zirconia) for strength and aesthetics.
Final tooth-coloured crown supported by a dental implant.
Provisional crown to protect the tooth while a definitive crown is being fabricated.
Apply desensitising agents to exposed or sensitive dentine.
An extra visit for irrigation/medication when more disinfection time is required.
Surgical root-end resection and sealing to manage persistent apical pathology.
Manage a separated instrument to re-establish canal patency.
Additional time to negotiate and instrument a calcified or sclerosed canal.
Emergency access, pulp removal and dressing for acute pain relief; definitive RCT to follow.
Temporary obturation or medicated filling between appointments.
Surgical debridement of periapical tissues associated with a root apex.
Filling/sealing of a single root canal following preparation.
Filling/sealing for each additional canal beyond the first.
Preparation and disinfection of a single root canal prior to obturation.
Preparation and disinfection for each additional canal beyond the first.
Remove a post to gain canal access for endodontic retreatment.

displayName: Removal of Existing Root Filling — per canal
description: Retreatment: remove gutta-percha/sealer or other material from a canal.
Resin sealant applied to pits and fissures of posterior teeth to prevent decay.
Topical fluoride varnish to strengthen enamel and reduce caries risk.
Fit and torque the implant abutment in preparation for the definitive crown.
Provisional crown on implant to shape soft tissue and aesthetics before definitive crown.
Implant level impression or digital scan for fabrication of implant crown.
Personalised oral hygiene instruction including brushing, flossing and interdental cleaning advice.
Laboratory-fabricated inlay/onlay (e.g., ceramic/composite) for moderate to extensive posterior restorations.
Surgical adjustment of gingiva/bone to expose sound tooth structure for restorative margins.
Open flap debridement to access root surfaces and bony defects in advanced periodontitis.
Targeted periodontal debridement for 1–3 teeth with localized disease.
Supportive periodontal care after active therapy; tailored debridement and reinforcement of home care.
Reassessment of periodontal status after initial therapy; records pockets, bleeding, and stability.
Localised mucogingival graft to increase keratinised tissue or root coverage.
Non-surgical debridement of root surfaces to reduce periodontal pocketing and inflammation.
Chairside soft or hard reline to improve denture fit.
Laboratory-processed reline for improved durability and fit.
Simple acrylic repair (e.g., crack repair) with or without impression.
Add an artificial tooth to an existing denture after extraction or tooth loss.
Complete mandibular denture replacing all lower teeth.
Complete maxillary denture replacing all upper teeth.
Cast cobalt–chromium framework partial denture for durability and comfort.
Acrylic partial denture replacing up to three teeth.
Acrylic partial denture replacing four or more teeth.
Direct composite resin restoration involving a single surface (buccal/lingual/incisal) on an anterior tooth.
Direct composite resin restoration of a single surface on a premolar or molar.
Direct composite resin restoration involving three or more surfaces on an anterior tooth.
Direct composite resin restoration of three or more surfaces on a premolar or molar.
Direct composite resin restoration involving two surfaces on an anterior tooth.
Direct composite resin restoration of two surfaces on a premolar or molar.
Glass ionomer restoration, commonly for cervical/root caries or interim restoration.
Short-term sedative or protective restoration pending definitive treatment.
Removal of plaque and calculus with polishing to improve gum health and hygiene.
Custom occlusal splint to protect teeth from bruxism and reduce TMJ/muscle symptoms.
Surgical recontouring of alveolar bone, typically to aid denture fit.
Irrigation, medicated dressing and review for alveolar osteitis post-extraction.
Surgical exposure of an unerupted tooth (often for orthodontic traction).
Incision and drainage of an odontogenic abscess to relieve infection and pain.
Replant and stabilise an avulsed permanent tooth when clinically indicated.
Removal of a retained root piece or fragment.
Routine extraction of an erupted tooth using forceps/elevators without flap or bone removal.
Extraction requiring surgical flap and/or bone removal and tooth sectioning.

toothNumberRules.notes: Default for third molars and impacted teeth.

description: Chairside composite veneer to alter colour/shape of anterior teeth.
Laboratory-made porcelain veneer to improve colour/shape of anterior teeth.
In-chair bleaching session(s) with professional-strength gels and light activation as indicated.
Custom trays with take-home bleaching gel and instructions.
Control bleeding with packing and/or suturing after extraction or soft-tissue injury.
Prescribe appropriate medication for dental infection or pain with instructions.
Selective grinding/polishing to improve occlusal contacts and comfort.
Short-course clear aligner therapy for mild crowding/spacing.
Short appointment for symptomatic relief (e.g., smoothing sharp edges, temporary dressing).
Biocompatible material applied directly to a small pulpal exposure to maintain vitality.
Protective liner placed over near-exposed dentine to avoid pulp exposure.
Partial pulp removal to relieve pain and preserve radicular vitality pending definitive care.
Clean and re-cement a de-bonded fixed partial denture.
Clean and re-cement a de-bonded crown.
Direct build-up to replace missing coronal structure prior to crown.
Laboratory-fabricated cast post and core for severely compromised teeth.
Placement of a prefabricated post and direct core in a root-filled tooth.
Bonded lingual wire retainer for post-orthodontic retention.
Fabrication of a vacuum-formed retainer for retention after orthodontics.
Excisional biopsy and removal of small soft tissue lesion for histopathology.
Incisional biopsy of a suspicious soft tissue lesion for histopathology.
Review and minor adjustment of existing occlusal splint.
Removal of sutures following dental surgery.
Bonding of fractured crown fragment when available and viable.
Reposition luxated tooth and apply short-term stabilisation.
Place flexible splint to stabilise teeth following trauma or replantation.
Remove flexible splint and polish after healing period.
Particulate graft/membrane at implant site or extraction socket to augment ridge.
Small field-of-view CBCT for endodontic, implant, or surgical planning.
Full mouth examination with charting, risk assessment, and treatment planning.
Problem-focused exam for acute pain, infection, or trauma.
Recall exam to review oral health and monitor previous treatment.
Surgical release of labial or lingual frenum to improve function or hygiene.
Complex implant placement (limited ridge width/height or proximity to anatomy).
Surgical placement of a single implant in favourable bone (no grafting).
Excision of inflamed operculum over partially erupted tooth, often mandibular molar.
Removal of coronal pulp tissue with medicament placement to preserve radicular pulp vitality.
Fixed appliance to maintain space following early loss of a primary tooth.
Preformed stainless steel crown for primary molar with extensive caries or after pulpotomy.
Two bitewing radiographs to assess interproximal caries and bone levels.
Panoramic radiograph for overall dentition, TMJ, and third molars.
Single periapical radiograph for tooth-level assessment (endodontic/periapical).
Transcrestal sinus floor elevation with grafting for posterior maxilla implant sites.
Excision of small benign soft-tissue lesion (e.g., fibroma); may include histopathology referral.
Section and remove a failed crown to allow new restorative or endodontic treatment.
Isolation with rubber dam for moisture control and safety during endodontic/restorative procedures.
Enamel reduction to create space or improve contact points during orthodontic alignment.
Short review to check aligner/retainer progress and make minor adjustments.
Fibre-reinforced composite splint to stabilise mobile teeth (segment).
Clean and re-bond a de-bonded porcelain or composite veneer.
Standard records set of intraoral and extraoral photographs for assessment or treatment planning.
Impressions or intraoral scan for study models, analysis, and appliance fabrication.
Core build-up to restore endodontically treated tooth prior to crown.
